g.title: C1_P3
g.text: C1
Creating and using a dataset with verifiable truth enables research and model training on textual deception.
Absence of conversational dataset with objective ground-truth for deception
Prior work lacked text-only datasets where each utterance could be checked against known facts.

g.title: C1_T4TEXT
g.text: T4TEXT dataset with affidavit-grounded deception labels
Transcribed and cleaned 150 TV-show sessions, providing conversation, affidavit facts and true contestant identity.

g.title: C1_P3->C1_T4TEXT
g.text: motivates creation of (Conf: 3)

g.title: C2_P1P2A1
g.text: C2
Designing a bottleneck architecture that extracts linguistic cues allows near-human textual deception detection.
Need for accurate text-only deception detector using linguistic cues
Humans are weak and prior automatic systems rely on non-text modalities or hand-crafted features.

g.title: C1_I1
g.text: Release and utilisation of T4TEXT for training/evaluating deception detectors
Make dataset publicly available (CC-BY) and employ it for benchmarking models.
Maturity: 3

g.title: C1_T4TEXT->C1_I1
g.text: enables (Conf: 3)

g.title: C2_BOT_ARCH
g.text: Bottleneck architecture extracting entailment, ambiguity, overconfidence, half-truth cues
LLM pipeline that first classifies four cues per snippet then aggregates them.

g.title: C2_P1P2A1->C2_BOT_ARCH
g.text: motivates design of (Conf: 2)

g.title: C3_BOT_ARCH_CUES
g.text: C3
Bottleneck cues provide interpretable explanations that can be mandated for safety-critical LLM use.
Bottleneck architecture outputs explicit per-snippet cue verdicts
Entailment, ambiguity, overconfidence, half-truth labels accompany predictions.

g.title: C2_F2
g.text: GPT-4 bottleneck model matches human accuracy
Empirical result: 39% accuracy vs 41% human; higher top-2 accuracy.

g.title: C2_BOT_ARCH->C2_F2
g.text: validated by (Conf: 3)

g.title: C2.3
g.text: Linguistic cue extraction is sufficient for near-human detection
Validated by results; shows explicit cues can replace implicit reasoning.

g.title: C2_F2->C2.3
g.text: implies (Conf: 2)

g.title: C2_I2
g.text: Deploy bottleneck-style detector in online moderation pipelines
Integrate algorithm to flag deceptive text in real-world platforms.
Maturity: 1

g.title: C2.3->C2_I2
g.text: suggests deployment (Conf: 1)

g.title: C3_F3
g.text: Explanations preferred by humans (higher e-ViL)
User studies show explanations more satisfactory than baselines.

g.title: C3_BOT_ARCH_CUES->C3_F3
g.text: produces (Conf: 3)

g.title: C4_F2F3
g.text: C4
Complementary strengths of model and humans motivate interactive tools for joint deception detection.
Model correct where humans fail; complementary error profile
Analysis shows model excels in sessions with many deceived judges.

g.title: C3_I3
g.text: Require LLMs to output linguistic-cue explanations in safety-critical decisions
Policy/technical mandate for transparent reasoning.
Maturity: 0

g.title: C3_F3->C3_I3
g.text: enables (Conf: 1)

g.title: C4_I4
g.text: Interactive UI surfacing model-flagged cues to human moderators
Tool displays ambiguity, half-truth indicators to aid human judgment.
Maturity: 0

g.title: C4_F2F3->C4_I4
g.text: motivates (Conf: 1)

g.title: C5.1
g.text: C5
Half-truth cue is most predictive, suggesting targeted training objectives for robustness.
Half-truth detection cue most impactful
Ablation shows largest accuracy drop when half-truth control removed.

g.title: C5_I5
g.text: Add half-truth detection loss during LLM fine-tuning
Explicitly supervise half-truth recognition to improve misinformation robustness.
Maturity: 0

g.title: C5.1->C5_I5
g.text: suggests (Conf: 1)
